result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Patti M Schaefer was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive sentence credit of 188 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
2.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink - no bars, taverns or restaurants.
If probation becomes revoked and the fine, court costs and attorney fees are not paid in full, Court orders payment during the period of extended supervision.
If probation becomes revoked and the fine, court costs and attorney fees are not paid in full, Court orders payment during the period of extended supervision.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the cash bond on file be first applied to the court appointed attorney fees and any balance then to the fines and costs.

Court orders the defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel - TO BE DETERMINED.  Court orders the cash bond on file be first applied to the court appointed attorney fees and any balance then to the fines and costs. 03/09/2015 - Court Appt'd Atty Fees - $1008.00.

1.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
2.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink - no bars, taverns or restaurants.

timeConds.notes: To commence immediately.  On April 16, 2015 Court amends the JOC to allow the defendant to go to the Goosebliond for purposes of employment only.

records.addlTxt:
3:57 P.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Saylor recites agreement - defendant will plea to OWI - 6th offense.  DA recites conditions.  Atty Saylor concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to on count 1 as charged.  Court dismisses count 2.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Saylor.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision, stayed and places the defendant on probation for a period of 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION and EXTENDED SUPERVISION

1 year in the county jail, to commence immediately and with Huber
$600 fine plus court costs
attorney fees
D.L. revocation - 36 months
IID - 36 months
AODA
Blood Draw Fee - $28.80
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink - no bars, taverns or restaurants.

Defendant is to receive credit for June 18, 2014 - 12/22/2014.

Statement by Atty Saylor regarding the ignition interlock device.

Court orders the case bond to the attorney fees and any balance to the fines and costs.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the SAP and not eligible for the CIP program.

Court adjourned at 4:13 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

2:36 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Saylor - requests a plea & sentencing date.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on February 9, 2015 at 4:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:37 p.m.
Bond Payments / Check #7181
from Circuit Court to the defendant's husband
Status hearing on January 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

10:18 a.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Max Saylor via telephone on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Saylor - needs to hear back from the DA's office.

Court makes statement - received letter from Charles Hieland regarding collateral for bond.  Court indicates it will be contacting Mr. Hieland - does not amend bond at this time.

Court directs Status Hearing be held after the first of the year.

Court adjourned at 10:20 a.m.
to Judge Slate from Charles Hieland with attachments

11:36 a.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Max Saylor.

Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Argument by Attorney Saylor.  Argument by DA - objects.  Statement by the defendant.  Court denies the motion to modify bond.  Court states the defendant may come up with a proposal for collateral in lieu of cash.

Court adjourned at 11:43 a.m.
to Modify Bond
to Modify Bond

State's
Status hearing on November 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

11:05 a.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Max Saylor.

Attorney Saylor indicates the defendant will be waiving her right to a preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of her right to a preliminary hearing - waived by the defendant - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Saylor.  Attorney Saylor confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Saylor enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs Status Hearing be scheduled.

Court adjourned at 11:08 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
1:13 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant regarding husband.  Statement by defendant.  Court grants the petition for appointment of counsel and will withhold payment of attorney fees at this time.  Statement by defendant regarding bond, requests a lower bond or signature bond.  Statement by DA, requests a new date to hear the request for bond modification.  Court will set for hearing in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.
Status hearing on September 16, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

10:10 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - does not want a public defender.  Court goes over request for court appointed counsel.  Statement by defendant, does not qualify for PD representation.  Court will take under consideration the request for court appointed counsel.

Cour adjourned at 10:14 a.m.
Status hearing on August 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

10:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court, in custody and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, does not qualify for PD representation and requests a court appointed attorney.  Court will set for status hearing in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 10:06 a.m.
Status hearing on July 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

10:22 a.m.  Defendant present in court, in custody and without counsel.  Chad Hendee as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, has left a message for Atty Haase as he represented her before, and has not heard anything back.  Statement by the Court - instructs the defendant that she first needs to apply to the Public Defender's office and be denied before she can request court appointed counsel.  Court will set for status hearing regarding counsel in 2 weeks.  

Court adjourned at 10:24 a.m.
Status hearing on July 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

10:08 a.m.  Defendant present in custody and in court without counsel.  Special Prosecutor Chuck Stertz for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Bond has been set.  Statement by the defendant.  Court goes over the right to counsel and how to obtain one.  Court instructs the defendant in regards to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing regarding counsel in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

1:06 p.m.  Defendant in custody and in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Special Prosecutor Scott Ceman for the State of Wisconsin.  Couort finds probable cause.  Special Prosecuter makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond set at $2,500.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Hearing - Monday morning.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.
